Pore/Structural Features.Structure Type: Hollow layered hydroxides nanocage with confined interlayer spacing and channels on thin shell

Other Information.Additional Info: Product (4) obtained in good yield (>90%). Acts as a reaction vessel for oxidative dehydrogenation.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Steric hindrance effect, cannot diffuse smoothly
Steric hindrance effect, cannot diffuse smoothly

Sieving Mechanism: Molecular sieving based on steric hindrance and diffusion differences within confined internal voids and channels of the hollow nanocage.

Experimental Validation.Method: Catalytic reactivity and selectivity measurements coupled with size comparisons of substrates
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: High chemoselectivity toward primary carbons; Yields: compound 1 (>90%), compound 2 (24%), compound 3 (18%).

Other Information.Additional Info: Hollow nano-shell with approx. 20 nm thickness, derived from ZIF-67 via self-templated thermal transformation and post-assembly of bimetallic catalytic active sites (TCPP-Fe/Cu). Used as a multifunctional molecular selector for oxidative dehydrogenation of aromatic hydrazides. The TCPP-Fe/Cu active sites are encapsulated within the hydroxide thin shell.
